summary: The Iranian Terror Prevention Act aims to designate specific organizations as foreign terrorist organizations (FTOs) and impose sanctions. The Secretary of State is mandated to designate these organizations within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The President must decide within 60 days whether to impose sanctions on listed organizations. Regular reports to Congress from the Secretary of State and the President are required regarding new entities meeting FTO criteria and sanction decisions, respectively, with justifications for any non-sanctioned organizations.
